title: Man Portable Aircraft System for Rapid In-situ Assembly

classifications.description: Aircraft capable of landing or taking-off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft having its flight directional axis horizontal when grounded the lift during taking-off being created by free or ducted propellers or by blowers the propellers being tiltable relative to the fuselage
Folding or collapsing to reduce overall dimensions, e.g. foldable tail booms
Compound rotorcraft, i.e. aircraft using in flight the features of both aeroplane and rotorcraft characterised by provision of fixed wings
Compound rotorcraft, i.e. aircraft using in flight the features of both aeroplane and rotorcraft with forward-propulsion propellers pivotable to act as lifting rotors
Compound rotorcraft, i.e. aircraft using in flight the features of both aeroplane and rotorcraft with provision for reducing drag of inoperative rotor
Aircraft capable of landing or taking-off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft
Aircraft capable of landing or taking-off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft having its flight directional axis vertical when grounded
Folding or collapsing to reduce overall dimensions of aircraft
Aircraft not otherwise provided for characterised by special use of the remote controlled vehicle type, i.e. RPV
Aircraft not otherwise provided for having multiple wings
Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plants using steam or spring force
Arrangements for mounting power plants in aircraft
Suspension arrangements specially adapted for supporting thrust loads, e.g. thrust links
UAVs specially adapted for particular uses or applications for transporting passengers; for transporting goods other than weapons for parcel delivery or retrieval
Efficient propulsion technologies, e.g. for aircraft

abstract: A man portable aircraft system includes first and second wings with first and second pylons couplable between pylon stations thereof to form an airframe. Each of a plurality of propulsion assemblies is couplable to one of a plurality of nacelle stations of the wings to form a two-dimensional distributed thrust array. A flight control system is couplable to the airframe and is operable to independently control each of the propulsion assemblies. A payload is couplable between payload stations of the first and second pylons. A man portable container is operable to receive the wings, pylons, propulsion assemblies, flight control system and payload in a disassembled configuration. The connections between the wings, pylons, propulsion assemblies and payload are operable for rapid in-situ assembly. In an assembled configuration, the aircraft is operable to transition between thrust-borne lift in a VTOL orientation and wing-borne lift in a biplane orientation.
claims:
1. A man portable aircraft system comprising:
a first wing having first and second pylon stations and a plurality of nacelle stations; a second wing having first and second pylon stations and a plurality of nacelle stations; a first pylon couplable between the first pylon stations of the first and second wings, the first pylon having a payload station; a second pylon couplable between the second pylon stations of the first and second wings, the second pylon having a payload station, the wings and the pylons operable to form an airframe; a plurality of propulsion assemblies each couplable to one of the nacelle stations of the first and second wings, the propulsion assemblies operable to form a two-dimensional distributed thrust array; a flight control system couplable to the airframe and operable to independently control each of the propulsion assemblies, the airframe, the propulsion assemblies and the flight control system operable to form an aircraft; a payload couplable between the payload stations of the first and second pylons; and a man portable container operable to receive the wings, the pylons, the propulsion assemblies, the flight control system and the payload in a disassembled configuration; wherein, connections between the wings, the pylons, the propulsion assemblies and the payload are operable for rapid in-situ assembly; and wherein, in an assembled configuration, the aircraft is operable to transition between thrust-borne lift in a VTOL orientation and wing-borne lift in a biplane orientation.

2. The system as recited in claim 1 wherein the connections between the pylons and the wings and the connections between the propulsion assemblies and the wings further comprise structural and electrical connections.
3. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise high speed fastening elements.
4. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise cam and hook connections.
5. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise quarter turn latch connections.
6. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise snap connections.
7. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise magnetic connections.
8. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise electromagnetic connections.
9. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the structural connections further comprise remotely releasable connections.
10. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the electrical connections further comprise pin and socket connections.
11. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the electrical connections further comprise communication channels.
12. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the electrical connections further comprise redundant communication channels.
13. The system as recited in claim 2 wherein the electrical connections further comprise triply redundant communication channels.
14. The system as recited in claim 1 wherein the connections between the payload and the pylons further comprise remotely releasable connections.
15. The system as recited in claim 1 wherein the payload includes one or more sensors such that the aircraft further comprises a man portable observation platform.

16. The system as recited in claim 1 wherein the flight control system is operable to independently control each of the propulsion assemblies responsive to at least one of remote flight control, autonomous flight control and combinations thereof.

18. The system as recited in claim 17 wherein each of the first and second pylons includes an inboard nacelle station and wherein the plurality of inboard propulsion assemblies includes an inboard propulsion assembly couplable to each of the inboard nacelle stations of the first and second pylons.

19. The system as recited in claim 17 wherein each of the first and second inboard nacelle stations of the first and second wings is positioned opposite one of the pylons stations of the first and second wings.

20. A man portable aircraft system comprising:
a first and second wings each having first and second pylon stations, first and second inboard nacelle stations and first and second outboard nacelle stations; a first pylon couplable between the first pylon stations of the first and second wings and a second pylon couplable between the second pylon stations of the first and second wings, the first and second pylons each having a payload station, the wings and the pylons operable to form an airframe; a plurality of inboard propulsion assemblies couplable to the first and second inboard nacelle stations of the first and second wings and a plurality of outboard propulsion assemblies couplable to the first and second outboard nacelle stations of the first and second wings, the propulsion assemblies operable to form a two-dimensional distributed thrust array; a flight control system couplable to the airframe and operable to independently control each of the propulsion assemblies responsive to at least one of remote flight control, autonomous flight control and combinations thereof, the airframe, the propulsion assemblies and the flight control system operable to form an aircraft; a payload couplable between the payload stations of the first and second pylons; and a man portable container operable to receive the wings, the pylons, the propulsion assemblies, the flight control system and the payload in a disassembled configuration; wherein, connections between the wings, the pylons, the propulsion assemblies and the payload are operable for rapid in-situ assembly; and wherein, in an assembled configuration, the aircraft is operable to transition between thrust-borne lift in a VTOL orientation and wing-borne lift in a biplane orientation.
